documents.document: Many patients and their families spend long hours in health care facilities especially because of #COVID19. Clean your hands! Make sure you wash your hands with soap and water or alcohol-based rub to keep infections at bay! #WorldHandHygieneDay https://t.co/j4aBOdLrMq

Infection prevention control (IPC) practitioners are experts on #HandHygiene and often teach techniques in health facilities! Be a role model for clean hands at point of care. If you are an IPC practitioner, post photos of your commitment tag us or your place of work. https://t.co/fPIwyPOQjx

Its World #HandHygieneDay! Make clean hands your habit! It protects all of us. #HandHygieneis one of the most effective actions you can take to reduce the spread of pathogens and prevent infections including #COVID19. https://t.co/y6vdVccpkE
For countries and areas outside of the WHO Western Pacific Region, please visit: https://t.co/VY9fK0B4Wd
@DOHgovph removed 15 cases previously included in total number of cases due to duplication. The total number of cases reported for 4 May 2021 has been corrected to 1,062,210.
The Ministry of Health, Labour, and Welfare of Japan updated the total number of deaths for 4 May 2021 to 10,420.
UPDATES: The Ministry of Health of Cambodia updated the total number of cases for 4 May 2021 to 16,299.

#COVID19 confirmed cases and deaths reported by countries and areas in the @WHO Western Pacific Region over the past 24 hours. For more info on #coronavirus cases in the Region, go to our dashboard: https://t.co/qQ2L14iMqi https://t.co/YiIGypt21R

Washing your hands frequently with soap and running water for at least 40-60 seconds can help stop the spread of infection. Make it a habit! Join the campaign here: https://t.co/x4tqt03Mgx #WorldHandHygieneDay https://t.co/dCvLS4UoeI

Make it easy to #CleanYourHands: Make sure #HandHygiene supplies are available where they are needed especially in health care facilities Teach people the right way to clean their hands https://t.co/x4tqt03Mgx https://t.co/L5LaT4jjYw

It's World #HandHygiene Day! Are you a #healthworker looking to improve how you #CleanYourHands? Take the #OpenWHO online course to support the #COVID19 response: learn how to prevent infections with good #HandHygiene https://t.co/OMDb7ZqhM4 https://t.co/y7Ta1cbfxd
Risk factors for developing #asthma include inhaling asthma triggers: Allergens Tobacco smoke Chemical irritants -#AirPollution https://t.co/2R9CY6r89y

Medication is not the only way to control #asthma. It is also important to avoid asthma triggers - stimuli that irritate and inflame the airways. With medical support, each asthma patient must learn what triggers they should avoid. https://t.co/UqkmsvaCrk

#Asthma can't be cured, but it can be managed. This includes: short-term medication to relieve symptoms use of medication daily to control inflammation prevent symptoms avoiding asthma triggers, like air pollution allergens https://t.co/KsWvINxsh8 https://t.co/dYS7nApojl
Do you have asthma? Does someone you love have #asthma? Learn more about the disease here: https://t.co/KsWvINfRpA https://t.co/dQbQWjW9T8

Today is #WorldAsthmaDay! #Asthma is a chronic disease of the air passages of the lungs which inflames narrows them. People with asthma experience recurrent attacks of breathlessness and wheezing, which vary in severity and frequency from person to person. https://t.co/RCE3S4s2jH
Do you have or do you know someone with asthma?
What are the differences between the various testing methods to diagnose #COVID19? Watch this video! https://t.co/wJKIHHTBEk

5 moments for#HandHygiene: Before touching a patient Before a clean/aseptic procedure After body fluid exposure risk After touching a patient After touching patient surroundings #CleanHands Save Lives! #CleanYourHands! https://t.co/kKvo1Eme6Y
Are you a health care worker? #CleanYourHands at the point of care. Now more than ever. Protect yourself and othersfrom #COVID19 and other disease withproper#HandHygiene https://t.co/5Lm7njNsqy

Washing your hands with soap and running water for at least 40-60 sec or alcohol-based hand rub for 20-30 sec can prevent infection. Clean hands save lives! We must provide the facilities to keep them clean. https://t.co/x4tqt03Mgx https://t.co/KKtmiveI4O

Its World #HandHygiene Day tomorrow! 712 M people worldwide have no running water at their health care facility. 1 in 4 health care facilities dont have basic water facilities. Learn more: https://t.co/x4tqt03Mgx https://t.co/nUNdhD5dZu

#COVID19 transmission: Transmission of some COVID-19 variants: With these new variants, it's even more important to: Stay at least 1 metre apart. Limit time in or avoid enclosed/crowded spaces. Wash our hands. Wear masks. https://t.co/BoyOJRaknx

Everyone should have a fair opportunity to attain good health. Yet, the places where people live, work and play can make it harder for some to reach their full health potential, while others have the conditions to thrive. Lets build a fairer, healthier world for everyone. https://t.co/mc4pJrsJz5

Sometimes, people may feel ill after receiving a vaccinebut that doesnt necessarily mean the illness is linked with the #COVID19 vaccine. https://t.co/KvPL9INeRZ #VaxFacts https://t.co/xj58BKwf1n

Its very rare for serious side effects to be caused by a vaccine, including for #COVID19 vaccines. As with any vaccine, health authorities are continuing to carefully monitor the introduction of COVID-19 vaccines to ensure they are safe for everyone. #VaxFacts https://t.co/JBt89hr20I

Just like with other vaccines, experiencing mild side effects after receiving a #COVID19 vaccine is normal and is a signal that your body is building protection against #coronavirus. Learn more: https://t.co/KvPL9INeRZ #VaxFacts https://t.co/TCVX7NkYGi
Draw Sing Dance Spend time in creative play with children at home. #MentalHealth #COVID19 https://t.co/tCar0JIJat
Practice proper #HandHygiene to help #StopTheSpread of #COVID19. https://t.co/i5VV8tNcBa

.@WHO's regional logistics team in the Western Pacific plays a crucial role in making sure life-saving medical supplies and equipment are ready to be shipped wherever and whenever needed during the #COVID19 pandemic and other emergencies. https://t.co/2IWpQY2kH7

Young and healthy? You are still at risk of #COVID19. #WearAMask Wash your hands frequently with soap and for at least 40-60 sec Keep at least 1 m distance from others. Avoid crowds and enclosed spaces. We are #InThisTogether. Help #StopTheSpread of COVID-19. https://t.co/ACFZLqtzT0

We continue to: Keep 1 metre distance. Avoid crowds and enclosed spaces. Wash hands frequently. #WearAMask Get vaccinated when its our turn! #DoItAll #InThisTogether against #COVID19 https://t.co/T02bZfbQPy

You remember sitting down next to your best friend? Sharing a quick meal? High fiving? Hugging? #VaccinesWork to bring us and our children closer to a normal we know. Back to school. Back to friends. Back to childhood. #WorldImmunizationWeek https://t.co/dVpXWHJ5dn
#VaccinesWork to bring us closer to a world where being healthy is for everyone. #HealthForAll https://t.co/GjfZpUGiTH

#VaccinesWork to bring us closer to #HealthForAll. Immunization reaches more people than any other health service, connecting families with health care systems and ensuring everyone has access to the care they need. #WorldImmunizationWeek https://t.co/CtukilUont

In the future, they will talk about #polio the way we talk about MySpace (sorry #MySpace) One day soon its going to be an archaic, foreign concept. #VaccinesWork to bring us closer to a world without polio. #EndPolio #WorldImmunizationWeek https://t.co/Qqrql33Kyw

#VaccinesWork to bring us closer to a without: Cervical #cancer #COVID19 Cholera Diphtheria Ebola Hep B Influenza Japanese encephalitis Measles Meningitis Mumps Pertussis Pneumonia Polio Rabies Rotavirus Rubella Tetanus Typhoid Varicella Yellow Fever #WorldImmunizationWeek https://t.co/oSdRLVEpsQ

Studies showed a reduction in illness and death after being vaccinated against COVID19. Together with other preventive measures, #COVID19 vaccines are important tools in bringing an end to the pandemic. Get vaccinated when its your turn. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/4AAbqsy6wG
Read the statement from @WHOMalaysia on vaccines and #COVID19 here: https://t.co/9Y8pHJXf7Y

#Vaccines save millions of lives each year. Before they are approved, #COVID19 vaccines must meet strenuous research and quality standards. The result: a safe and effective defense against severe illness and death from COVID-19. https://t.co/nedcJvXJd8

Even if you take a #COVID19 test before traveling, its still possible to be in the early incubation stage of the illness. And traveling risks exposure to #coronavirus. Maintain hand washing, mask wearing physical distancing when traveling. #InThisTogether https://t.co/6DTqZ3Rzc2
#WearAMask while travelling, even if youve already been vaccinated. https://t.co/8lxWhg5ETh

If you are travelling, its important to continue practicing safety measures whether you have been vaccinated or not. -Keep a distance of at least 1m from others -Wash your hands often for at least 40-60 seconds w/ soap and water or alcohol-based handrub -#WearAMask #COVID19 https://t.co/Ko1tjdLfZW

Quitting tobacco promotes physical and #MentalHealth and reduces your risk of #COVID19. Get started: set a quit date in the next week seek professional advice plan ahead to manage cravings ask for support from loved ones follow through with your plans #NoTobacco https://t.co/COemHGrlIP
RT @WHOWPRO: #China drove down its indigenous #malaria cases from 30M a year in the 1940s to zero indigenous cases in 2017! The country

#VaccinesWork to bring us one step closer to the people and moments we love. Friends. Family. A long hug. Support systems. Birthday parties. Game nights. Dinner out. Quote this tweet and let us know what youre looking forward to! https://t.co/0PMlNhz1DR

Successful surveillance, strong national plans and changes to how the programme worked during #COVID19 were among the strategies adapted by countries to help them reach their 2020 goals to #EndMalaria. Read more: https://t.co/yaRR0gVe4q https://t.co/fxc1mj1dFY

@WHO @APLMA_Malaria @takeshi_kasai @MalariaNoMore #Malaysias national malaria plan has successfully eliminated a disease the country has been battling since the 1900s maintaining zero indigenous cases even during the #COVID19 pandemic! Read more: https://t.co/tkBf4Hpkdy https://t.co/KPdGMrIFMh
